name: Teon Brooks
bio:
- He studies the cognitive processes and temporal dynamics of the brain during reading.
 - Core developer for MNE, a community-driven project for analyzing time-series brain data in Python; and OpenEXP, an open science platform founded to be a "GitHub for Experiments" and a tool for running both behavioral and physiological experiments using open-source web-based tools.
 - Develops curriculum, DIYCogSci, for teaching experimental research methods and coding using low-cost electronics and open-source hardware.
affiliations: Postdoctoral researcher at the Center for Reproducible Neuroscience and the Department of Psychology at Stanford University

name: Karolina Andersdotter
bio:
- Librarian and digital asset and media manager.
- Believes Internet is the collective intelligence of humankind—much like a library.
- Enjoys talking copyright, digital privacy, and how to make data less scary.
quote: The Internet is the collective intelligence of humankind—much like a library.
affiliations: Policy and Advocacy Assistant, IFLA

name: Cori Zarek
bio:
- Senior Fellow leading the Mozilla Tech Policy Fellows team
- Former Deputy U.S. Chief Technology Officer at the White House
- Coordinated U.S. involvement with the global Open Government Partnership
quote: Continuing to advance important tech policy issues is key to Internet Health. The Mozilla Tech Policy Fellows will be working to increase momentum on issues like net neutrality, privacy, and the digital economy.
affiliations: Mozilla Senior Tech Policy Fellow focused on tech policy and transparency.

name: Kirstie Whitaker
bio:
- Postdoctoral researcher in the Brain Mapping Unit at the University of Cambridge
 - She studies adolescent brain development and is particularly interested in the emergence of mental health disorders during the teenage years. 
 - She's the founder and lead developer of the STEMM Role Models project which provides a database of experts from traditionally under-represented groups to ensure conference organizers are able to invite the most diverse and exciting speakers to their events.
affiliations: Neuroimaging Researcher, University of Cambridge
Founder and lead developer of the STEMM Role Models project

name: Anthony Negron
bio:
- Manager of Digital Programming, NYSCI
- Longtime member of HiveNYC
- Values parternships formed via Hive
quote: You have an experience with an organization where you gel so perfectly that you start thinking about other ways to collaborate.
affiliations: Manager of Digital Programming, New York Hall of Science

name: Linet Kwamboka
bio:
- CEO at DataScience LTD
- Director - World Data Lab, Africa
quote: For a healthier Internet, the players in this space need to feel comfortable and confident that the information they provide will not be used for maliciously targeted or even criminal activities.
affiliations: Mozilla Tech Policy Fellow
CEO at DataScience LTD
Director - World Data Lab, Africa

name: Emily Long
quote: Working with others is what really helps us grow as an organization. It gives us more projects and more room to experiment.
affiliations: Director of Communications & Development, The LAMP

name: Duncan Washington
quote: Mozilla Clubs use local solutions on the ground to make an impact in society.
affiliations: Deputy Research Director and Data Analyst, Digital Divide Data
Research Analyst & Project Lead, Digital Skills Observatory

name: Alan Davidson
bio:
- Fellow at New America in Washington, D.C.
- Former Director of Digital Economy at the U.S. Department of Commerce and a Senior Advisor to the Secretary of Commerce
quote: At a time of great challenge and opportunity, this new Mozilla program will add much-needed resources to the continued fight for a free, open, and inclusive broader digital economy.
affiliations: Mozilla Tech Policy Fellow working on a census of healthy Internet policy and strategy.

name: Ariam Mogos
quote: Mozilla has facilitated fantastic partnerships. Instead of running siloed programs we're really collaborating.
affiliations: Education Innovation Specialist, UNICEF
Founder + Global Project Lead, Nairobi Play Project

name: Hillary Kolos
quote: I really trust the people I work with in the Hive. That means that I can be more critical and more supportive.
affiliations: Director of Digital Programming, DreamYard Project

name: Gigi Sohn
bio:
- Distinguished Fellow at the Georgetown Law Institute for Technology Law & Policy
- Open Society Foundations Leadership in Government Fellow
- Former Counselor to the Chairman of the U.S. Federal Communications Commission, Tom Wheeler
quote: The Mozilla Tech Policy Fellowship provides me the resources and the community I need to advocate on behalf of open, affordable and democratic communications networks.
affiliations: Mozilla Tech Policy Fellow fighting for an open, affordable and democratic Internet.

name: Jen Caltrider
bio:
- I studied to get my master's degree in Artificial Intelligence but hated writing code (OK, I was terrible at it). So I ended up combining my love of storytelling and all things nerdy and went to work at CNN as their first ever technology producer. 
- I moved to Colorado and fell in love with the mountains and with the camping mantra, "Leave it Better Than You Found It." That's what motivated me to move from journalism to advocacy work. I still get to tell stories, I'm just telling them for good now.
- I have many long conversations with my two pups, Husker and Beulah, and my kitty Stumpy about how it's a real shame Neal Stephenson's classic cyberpunk novel Snow Crash hasn't yet been made into an Oscar-worthy film.
quote: I love the internet and all it has to offer and want everyone in the world to be able to access it and feel safe to be themselves online. This is what gets me fired up every day.
affiliations: Global Campaigner, Mozilla

name: Chrystian Rodriguez
affiliations: Network Manager, Hive NYC, Mozilla

name: Kylee Durant
bio:
- Chief Operating Officer, RallyPoint/6 
 - Provides career resources and peer assistance for service members, veterans, and military families
quote: It was really powerful to see somebody from Mozilla who didn't just think about a great idea—but how to actually turn that idea into action.
affiliations: Vice President of Transition Technology & Innovation Programs for the USO

name: Éireann Leverett
bio:
- As an Open Web Fellow, Eireann is working with Privacy International’s Tech Team to analyze surveillance documentation and data, identify and analyze new technologies, and help develop briefings and educational programming with a technical understanding.
 - Éireann is fascinated by malware, vulnerabilities, cryptography, networks, information theory, and economics — and he believes hacking can win victories for humanity.
affiliations: Founder and CEO, Concinnity Risks
Senior Risk Researcher at Cambridge Centre for Risk Studies

name: Georgia Bullen
bio:
- Human Centered Designer with a focus on data, technology and policy
- Passionate about visualization, spreadsheets, usability, maps, access, cities and open source
- Lives by a philosophy of organized chaos
affiliations: Director of Technology Projects, New America's Open Technology Institute

name: Hera Hussain
bio:
- Community & Partnerships Manager, OpenCorporates 
 - Founder of Chayn, a global volunteer-led digital network empowering women against violence and oppression 
 - Works with investigative journalists and NGOs running investigations using open company data
quote: No matter how dangerous it is for young women to be online, they still want to get online. Their social activities are there. Now there are so many things you can only do online.
affiliations: Community & Partnerships Manager, Open Corporates
Founder, Chayn
Co-Founder, EmpowerHack

name: Daniel Lucio
affiliations: Community Impact Manager, Google Fiber

name: Jennifer Helsby
bio:
- Jennifer is a data scientist and researcher passionate about using data and technology to catalyze social change. 
 - Previously, she was a postdoctoral researcher at the Center for Data Science and Public Policy at the University of Chicago, where she worked on applying machine learning methods to problems in public policy. 
 - As an Open Web Fellow, Jennifer is working with the Freedom of the Press Foundation to improve SecureDrop, an anonymous whistleblowing platform.
affiliations: Co-founder and CTO of Lucy Parsons Labs
Co-organizer for Cryptoparty Chicago

name: Alex Wafula
bio:
- Software professional and community activist 
 - Leader in the Kenya + East Africa Mozilla community 
 - Digital Skills Observatory contributor
quote: The people are a big part of why I joined Mozilla—and the reason I continue to contribute.
affiliations: Digital Skills Observatory contributor

name: Brenda Hernandez
bio:
- I am a Chicago-born, Mexican-raised experiential learning enthusiast, and practitioner.
- Before my current role as Portfolio Strategist, I was a program manager at Yollocalli Arts Reach of the National Museum of Mexican Art - a place dear to my heart as I was a student there during my youth!
- I am fascinated with the complexities the internet brings to our understanding of culture, humor, and aesthetics. I miss the days of custom cursors and crude myspace hacks.
quote: I am fascinated with the complexities the internet brings to our understanding of culture, humor, and aesthetics.
affiliations: Portfolio Strategist, Hive Chicago, Mozilla

name: Gideon Thomas
bio:
- Worked at Seneca College's CDOT as a developer on Mozilla's Thimble which opened the pathway for me to work for Mozilla.
 - Enjoy developing open-source technology solutions that make it easy for people to learn about and participate in creating the open web.
 - Occasionally like to co-facilitate events that address social issues.
affiliations: Software Developer, Mozilla

name: Egle Marija Ramanauskaite
bio:
- Citizen science coordinator for the Human Computation Institute, focused on crowdsourcing Alzheimer’s research  
 - Met Janet Chapman at MozFest last year and worked with her to create Crowd2Map
quote: Finally, we’re bringing this awesome research to the public.
affiliations: Citizen Science Coordinator, Human Computation Institute
Co-Founder, Crowd2Map Tanzania

name: Bruno Miguel Pereira Vieira
bio:
- Bioinformatics and population genomics PhD student at WurmLab (Queen Mary University of London) researching how genetic diversity is affected by sociality in insects.
 - Founded the open source community Bionode.io with the goal of improving modularity and reusability of tools and code in bioinformatics by leveraging innovation coming from the Node.js and Web communities.
affiliations: Bioinformatics PhD student at Queen Mary University of London
Node.js web developer

name: Danielle Robinson
bio:
- Passionate about improving reproducibility and digital literacy in the sciences
 - Co-organizes Open Insight PDX, which seeks to build skills that enhance research reproducibility and facilitate discussion of issues surrounding publishing, data sharing, and copyright. 
 - She is a founding member of Women in Science Portland and an organizer for Science Hack Day Portland.
affiliations: Neuroscience PhD, Oregon Health & Science University
Founding member of Women in Science Portland

name: Mmaki Jantjies
bio:
- Head of Department of Information Systems at the University of the Western Cape and Regional Coordinator for the Mozilla Women & Girls Clubs 
 - Lectures on IT security, IT project management, and other IT-related modules 
 - Recruits women who want to give back to the community
quote: The Mozilla Women & Girls clubs have become a space of trust—people open up about challenges they face on a daily basis.
affiliations: Head of the Department of Information Systems, University of the Western Cape

name: Christie Bahlai
quote: During my fellowship I developed an open science and reproducible research course — my students' work was then highlighted in Science Magazine.
affiliations: Ecologist, Zipkin Lab, Department of Integrative Biology, Michigan State university.
Associate Scientist, Kellogg Biological Station Long Term Ecological Research Site (NSF-funded)

name: Diego Naranjo
bio:
- Diego Naranjo is a qualified lawyer and co-founder of the Andalusian human rights organisation Grupo 17 de Marzo.
 - Diego joined EDRi in October 2014 where he works as Senior Policy Advisor. He advocates for the protection of citizens' fundamental rights and freedoms online in the fields of data protection, surveillance and copyright. 
 - In the past, Diego gained experience in the International Criminal Tribunal for former Yugoslavia, the EU Fundamental Rights Agency (FRA) and the Free Software Foundation Europe. Previously to all that he worked as a lawyer in Spain.
affiliations: Senior Policy Advisor, European Digital Rights (EDRi)

name: Achintya Rao
bio:
- Communications Officer, CMS Experiment at CERN 
 - ChD Student, UWE Science Communication Unit 
 - Mentors two Mozilla Open Science Lab projects
quote: I now have a virtual support structure—people I can ping and ask, “Hey, what do I do here?” Or, “Have you faced this?
affiliations: Science communicator for the CMS Collaboration at CERN’s Large Hadron Collider
PhD candidate, University of the West of England

name: Roy Lamond
affiliations: VP, Program Development, Digital Opportunity Trust

name: Melissa Mark-Viverito
quote: Technology has the power to transform lives, and we must work to bring that opportunity to people of all backgrounds.
affiliations: Speaker, New York City Council

name: David Humphrey
bio:
- Developer and open source expert
 - Professor at Seneca College’s School of Information and Communications Technology
 - Since 2004, David and Mozilla have involved hundreds of students in research projects — developing new technologies and standards for the web
quote: I teach how to participate in collaborative projects. I set up a bike lane, so we’re on the same road as Mozilla, but we’re off to the side.
affiliations: Professor, Seneca College

name: Théo Chevalier
bio:
- Supporting our global community for translating Mozilla Foundation projects
 - Advancing Mozilla’s localization QA tool, Transvision
 - Localizing Mozilla projects into French
affiliations: Localization Project Manager, Mozilla

name: Solana Larsen
bio:
- Danish-Puerto Rican writer and editor based in Berlin, Germany
 - Believer and practitioner in use of the Internet for good
 - Former Managing Editor of GlobalVoices.org
affiliations: Editor, Internet Health Report, Mozilla

name: Joe McNamee
bio:
- Executive Director of European Digital Rights (EDRi), an association of civil and human rights organisations that defends citizens’ rights and freedoms in the digital environment 
 - Focuses on data protection, surveillance, copyright, and network neutrality 
 - Expert in public affairs, intellectual property, cybercrime, and telecoms policy
quote: The biggest challenge we face in Europe is the role that internet companies play in achieving public policy goals.
affiliations: Executive Director, European Digital Rights (EDRi)
